location.name: London, London, City of obsolete, United Kingdom

title: Senior Marketing Specialist - International Campaigns
content:
Location: London, UK
 
About OpenTable
With millions of diners, tens of thousands of restaurants, and 23+ years of experience, OpenTable, part of Booking Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ: BKNG), is an industry leader with a unique insight into the world of hospitality. We champion restaurants, bars, wineries, and other venues around the world, helping them attract guests, manage capacity, improve operations and increase revenue.
Every employee at OpenTable has a tangible impact on what we do and how we do it. Join a global network that includes OpenTable and KAYAK's portfolio of travel brands including Swoodoo, checkfelix, momondo, Cheapflights, Mundi and HotelsCombined.
Hospitality is all about looking after others. You’ll work in a welcoming environment, and get the benefits and flexibility to succeed.
The Position
We are looking for a highly organised, driven, and passionate Senior Marketing Specialist, International Campaign Management, to join us on the International Marketing team to drive and manage integrated marketing campaigns across international markets. This is a role with a global scope and is perfect for someone who thrives in a collaborative and open environment. 
The ideal candidate will be a strong project manager and excellent communicator, optimally partnering with creatives, B2C and B2B channel marketing, product marketing, as well as functional stakeholders to define, and project lead the entire life cycle of multi-country growth and marketing campaigns. Your work will reflect your passion and interest in dining and restaurant culture. 
You are quick-acting, attentive to details, independent, but also able to work through stakeholder requirements with a positive and flexible demeanour. Being organized, ability to handle feedback and ‘make-it-work’ mentality are critical factors to succeed in this role. 
 
Responsibilities 

End-to-end project management of international growth and marketing campaigns from delivery plan, resource planning, project coordination, briefing, liaison and alignment on KPIs with stakeholders, results tracking and optimisation of processes. 
Responsible for receiving and drafting campaign briefs, developing and localising timelines, and all project management involved in campaign execution including managing production pipeline. Hands-on support on campaign landing page creation using internal tools as and when required.
Partner with our internationally distributed team of market and channel owners to build campaign pipelines, receive requests, source project details, draft briefs, align objectives, and communicate updates and next steps.
Partner with Product Marketing to localise new features GTM plans for international markets, taking into consideration local nuance and compliance requirements.
Closely monitor campaign development progress, test, learn, and improve processes based on learnings, then adjust, reapply, and scale where it works.
Able to come up with ideas and solutions quickly when problems and opportunities arise.
We have an upbeat and results-oriented work culture, and we expect you to be both inspiring to work with and proactively contribute to the marketing direction and campaigns based on data and consumer insights.

Required Skills

Bachelor’s degree in marketing or related fields. 
5+ years of marketing experience from a similar position at an agency or in-house.
Excellent interpersonal skills and collaboration; comfortable working alongside multi-function teams with good presentation skills.
High operational focus and experience in hands-on project management.
Dedicated, resourceful, detailed and highly organised. Results driven; a motivated, autonomous achiever, someone who can develop a plan from scratch and drive cross-functional teams to successful conclusions.
Insightful; ability to process and understand local market trends and data, transforming insight into action.
Proactive, organised, and hardworking. Ability to work against timelines in a fast-paced, high-productivity environment. 
Love of the internet, digital and testing, learning, iterating.
Fluency in English at a native proficiency - fluency in one additional European language a plus.

Benefits: 

Vacation: you accrue 25 days a year or 33 days for our CSR Team
One Celebration Day per calendar year
Private Health & Dental and Life Insurances
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Pension Fund
Gym Discount
Bike2Work
Season Loan Ticket
Reimbursable eye tests and 100 GBP contribution towards VDU glasses only
Perkbox & Booking.com business discounts

 
Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion:
OpenTable aspires to be a workplace that reflects the diverse communities we serve and a culture that is inclusive and welcoming. Hiring people with different backgrounds, experiences, perspectives, and ideas is critical to innovation and to how we deliver great experiences for our users and our partners. Representation matters.
We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform job responsibilities, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

questions.label: How did you hear about this job?

questions.description: KAYAK Software Corporation, OpenTable, Inc., their respective subsidiaries and Momondo A/S (together, ‘KAYAK and OpenTable”, “our/we/us”, or “Company”) will process your personal data in accordance with applicable data protection laws for the purposes described in our privacy notice (Germany and All Other Locations). As part of the application process KAYAK and/or OpenTable may share your personal data across our group of companies, subject to our privacy notice and applicable laws.  In order to consider you for new positions, KAYAK and/or OpenTable may keep your personal data for 6 months (within the EU) and 2 years (in all other regions), unless otherwise required by applicable law.
